title: Active Learning-Based Curriculum for Integrated STEM Programming Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts and introductory STEM field understanding
context.additional_context: A blended environment combining face-to-face workshops and online learning, with practical programming projects using low-code platforms

learning_goals: Learners can design a mobile application prototype that solves real-life problems through STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) integration.

Learners can design and implement a simple application (e.g., to-do list manager) incorporating conditional logic (IF-THEN-ELSE), iterative loops (FOR EACH), and event handling (button clicks) using low-code development tools (e.g., Microsoft Power Apps, Appsmith) within 2–4 weeks.

Learners, in 4-member teams, select one public health topic (e.g., community nutritional imbalance, school meal hygiene management) and develop a digital solution prototype (app/web/infographic) within 3 weeks, achieving a grade of 'B+' or higher in at least four of five evaluation rubric criteria (creativity, feasibility, technical completeness, public health contribution, user-friendliness).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
